Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type A kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: narrow black band at top of rim; painted decoration consisting of lion (part of mane, shoulder and back remaining) to right; pendant roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: For other Type A kantharoi, see Williams 1983, 170-1, no. 57, fig. 12. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983. For parallels regarding the painted decoration, see British Museum 1888,0601.472.e and 1888,0601.472.h.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1657) (phase 2)
